parse.title: List of international presidential trips made by Shavkat Mirziyoyev

text.*:
Shavkat Mirziyoyev.
With Russian President in April 2017
With Iranian President in September 2017

This is a list of international presidential trips made by Shavkat Mirziyoyev, the 2nd President of Uzbekistan.

Contents

  • 1 2017
  • 2 2018
  • 3 Number of visits
  • 4 Visits hosted in Uzbekistan by Shavkat Mirziyoyev
    • 4.1 State Visits
    • 4.2 Working visits
  • 5 References

2017[edit]

Mirziyoev in Moscow, April 5, 2017.
Country Areas visited Date(s) Notes
Turkmenistan Ashgabat,

Türkmenabat

March 6–7 State Visit. Met with Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedow. Inaugurated a memorial complex in Türkmenabat, and unveiled a bust of Islam Karimov.[1][2]
Kazakhstan Astana March 22–23 State Visit. Met with President Nursultan Nazarbayev[3][4][5]
Russia Moscow April 4–5 State Visit. Met with President Vladimir Putin[6][7]
Kazakhstan South Kazakhstan Region April 29 Working Visit.[8]
China Beijing May 10–14 State Visit. Also took part in the "One Belt, One Road" international forum in Beijing. Met Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.[9][10]
Turkmenistan Ashgabat May 19–20 Working Visit.[11]
Saudi Arabia Riyadh May 20–21 Attended the Arab Islamic American summit. Met Presidents of Azerbaijan,Tajikistan, Kazakhstan, United States, Afghanistan, Prime Minister of Kyrgyzstan, Foreign Minister of Turkey, King of Saudi Arabia.[12]
Kazakhstan Astana June 8–9 Attended a session of the Council of the Heads of State of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) and opening of Astana EXPO. Met King of Spain,

Presidents of Kyrgyzstan and Afghanistan,Prime Ministers of Pakistan and India.[13]

Kyrgyzstan Bishkek September 5–6 Historic State Visit. Signing the package of documents about cooperation and border demarcation.[14]It was the first visit to Kyrgyzstan by an Uzbek president in 17 years.[15]
Kazakhstan Astana September 9–10 Attended summit of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation on Science and Technology, EXPO closing ceremony, held bilateral meetings with the Presidents of Turkey, Iran and Afghanistan.
Turkmenistan Ashgabat September 17 Attended the opening ceremony of the 5th Asian Indoor and Martial Arts Games,

met Presidents of Turkmenistan and Tajikistan.[16]

United States New York City 18-20 September Attended the UN General Assembly, met President of Bulgaria, Prime Minister of Georgia, UN Secretary General, President of World Bank Group, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund, attended Uzbek-US business forum, met Uzbek citizens living in New York.
Russia Sochi October 11 Attended the CIS summit, met Presidents of Russia and Belarus.
Turkey Ankara, Istanbul October 25-27 State Visit
South Korea Seoul November 22-25 State Visit
Russia Moscow December 26 Working visit, attending the Informal meeting of the CIS Heads of State

2018[edit]

Mirziyoyev and Tajik President Emomali Rahmon at Dushanbe International Airport, March 9, 2018.
Mirziyoyev signing the guest book before meeting with U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo at the State Department, on May 17, 2018.
Country Areas visited Date(s) Notes
Tajikistan Dushanbe March 9-10 State Visit[17]
Kazakhstan Astana March 15 Working Visit. Attended a summit of the heads of five Central Asian countries.[18]
United States Washington, D.C. May 15-17 Official Visit, met Donald Trump, Mike Pompeo, held meetings in Congress and Pentagon[19][20]
China Qingdao June 9-10 Attended the SCO Summit, met leaders of China, Russia,India, Pakistan, Afghanistan and First deputy of the UN General Secretary.[21]
Russia Moscow June 14 Attended the opening ceremony of the 2018 FIFA World Cup[22]
Kazakhstan Astana July 5-6 Working visit.[23]
Turkmenistan Ashgabat August 24 Working Visit, Aral Sea Summit[24]
Kyrgyzstan Cholpon-Ata September 3-4 Working Visit[25][26][27]
Tajikistan Dushanbe September 27-28 Working Visit[28][29][30]
India New Delhi October 1-2 State Visit[31]
France Paris October 9-10 State Visit[32]
Belgium Bruxelles October (probably after the visit to France) Working Visit
Azerbaijan Baku Expected in November State Visit[33]

Number of visits[edit]

Country Visits
 Kazakhstan 6
 Russia 4
 Turkmenistan 4
 United States 2
 China 2
 Kyrgyzstan 2
 Saudi Arabia 1
 Turkey 1
 South Korea 1
 Tajikistan 1

Visits hosted in Uzbekistan by Shavkat Mirziyoyev[edit]

Since September 2016, all the visits to Uzbekistan have had the character of working visits. Mostly it was giving honor to the First President Islam Karimov at his burial site. On 16 September 2017, Kazakh President Nursultan Nazarbayev visited Uzbekistan with state visit. That was the first state visit hosted by Mirziyoyev in Tashkent.[34]

State Visits[edit]

Country Name Title Date
 United Nations Antonio Guterres UN Secretary General June 10–11, 2017
 Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev President of Kazakhstan September 16–17,
 Kyrgyzstan Almazbek Atambayev President of Kyrgyzstan October 5–6
 Afghanistan Ashraf Ghani President of Afghanistan December 4-5[35]
 Kyrgyzstan Sooronbay Jeenbekov President of Kyrgyzstan December 13-14
 Turkmenistan Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov President of Turkmenistan April 23-24, 2018
 Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan President of Turkey April 29-May 1, 2018
 Tajikistan Emomali Rahmon President of Tajikistan August 16-17, 2018[36]
 Egypt Abdel Fattah el-Sisi President of Egypt September 4-5, 2018[37]
 Belarus Alexander Lukashenko President of Belarus September 13-14, 2018
 Russia Vladimir Putin President of Russia Mid autumn[38]
 Iran Hassan Rouhani President of Iran Expected in winter

Working visits[edit]

Mirziyoyev with Vladimir Putin in Samarkland in 2016
Country Name Title Date
 Russia Vladimir Putin President of Russia September 6, 2016
 Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev President of Kazakhstan September 12, 2016
 Belarus Alexander Lukashenko President of Belarus October 6, 2016
 Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan President of Turkey November 17–18, 2016
 Kyrgyzstan Almazbek Atambayev President of Kyrgyzstan December 24, 2016
 Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev President of Kazakhstan March 21, 2018
 Afghanistan Ashraf Ghani President of Afghanistan March 26–27, 2018
